document.title: Getting Started with Next.js 14: A Comprehensive Guide
document.description: Learn how to build modern web applications with Next.js 14, featuring App Router, Server Components, and advanced optimization techniques.

body.raw:
# Getting Started with Next.js 14 Next.js 14 introduces powerful new features that make building modern web applications faster and more efficient. In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the latest features and best practices. ## What Makes Next.js 14 Special? Next.js 14 brings significant improvements to the developer experience and application performance: - **App Router**: A new routing paradigm with nested layouts and loading states - **Server Components**: Render components on the server for better performance - **Turbopack**: A faster bundler for development (still experimental) - **Improved Image Optimization**: Better performance and WebP support ## Setting Up Your First Next.js 14 Project ```bash npx create-next-app@latest my-app --typescript --tailwind --eslint --app cd my-app npm run dev ``` This command creates a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, and the new App Router. ## Understanding the App Router The App Router introduces a new way to organize your application: ``` app/ ├── layout.tsx # Root layout ├── page.tsx # Home page ├── about/ │ ├── page.tsx # About page │ └── layout.tsx # About layout └── blog/ ├── page.tsx # Blog listing └── [slug]/ └── page.tsx # Individual blog post ``` ## Server Components vs Client Components ### Server Components (Default) ```tsx // app/components/ServerComponent.tsx export default function ServerComponent() { // This runs on the server const data = fetchDataFromAPI() return (

Server Component

Data: {data}

) } ``` ### Client Components ```tsx // app/components/ClientComponent.tsx 'use client' import { useState } from 'react' export default function ClientComponent() { const [count, setCount] = useState(0) return } ``` ## Advanced Features ### Loading States ```tsx // app/blog/loading.tsx export default function Loading() { return (
) } ``` ### Error Boundaries ```tsx // app/error.tsx 'use client' export default function Error({ error, reset, }: { error: Error reset: () => void }) { return (

Something went wrong!

) } ``` ## Performance Optimization ### Image Optimization ```tsx import Image from 'next/image' export default function OptimizedImage() { return ( ) } ``` ## Conclusion Next.js 14 represents a significant leap forward in React development. The App Router, Server Components, and improved performance features make it easier than ever to build fast, scalable web applications. Start building with Next.js 14 today and experience the future of React development!

document.excerpt: # Getting Started with Next.js 14 Next.js 14 introduces powerful new features that make building modern web applications faster and more efficient. In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the...

body.raw:
Demonstrated expertise in developing and maintaining applications on the AWS platform. This certification validates skills in designing, deploying, and debugging cloud-based applications using AWS services.

## Key Skills Validated

- **Compute Services**: EC2, Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk
- **Storage Solutions**: S3, DynamoDB, RDS
- **Networking**: VPC, API Gateway, CloudFront
- **Security**: IAM, Cognito, KMS
- **Deployment**: CloudFormation, CodePipeline

## Preparation Journey

Spent 3 months studying AWS documentation, hands-on labs, and practice exams. Built multiple serverless applications and deployed them using AWS services.

body.raw:
Certified in designing, building, and deploying applications on Google Cloud Platform. Expertise in cloud-native application development and DevOps practices.

## Expertise Areas

- **Container Orchestration**: Kubernetes Engine (GKE)
- **Serverless Computing**: Cloud Functions, Cloud Run
- **Databases**: Firestore, Cloud SQL, BigQuery
- **CI/CD**: Cloud Build, Cloud Deploy
- **Monitoring**: Cloud Monitoring, Cloud Logging

## Learning Experience

Completed intensive training program covering GCP fundamentals, advanced services, and best practices. Built production-ready applications using Google Cloud services.

document.title: E-Commerce Platform
document.description: A full-stack e-commerce solution built with Next.js, featuring real-time inventory management, secure payments, and an intuitive admin dashboard.
document.approach: Built a modern e-commerce platform using Next.js 14 with App Router, implementing secure payment processing with Stripe, real-time inventory management, and a comprehensive admin dashboard.
challenges: Implementing secure payment processing with PCI compliance
Building real-time inventory synchronization across multiple warehouses
Creating an intuitive admin dashboard for inventory management
solutions: Integrated Stripe Elements for secure payment processing
Implemented WebSocket connections for real-time inventory updates
Built a responsive admin dashboard with data visualization
document.architectureDiagram: graph TD A[Next.js Frontend] --> B[API Routes] B --> C[PostgreSQL Database] B --> D[Stripe API] B --> E[Redis Cache] F[Admin Dashboard] --> B
